Vulnerability.Title: powertop bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: The PowerTOP utility detects software components with unnecessarily high power usage on an idle computer. PowerTOP also provides a set of commands to reduce power usage on the system. This update fixes the following bugs: Previously, PowerTOP report file names were generated in an unclear, undocumented way. With this update, the implementation has been improved, and the generated file names now respect the names requested by the user. This applies to both CSV and HTML reports. (BZ#1039822) Previously, in virtualized environments like KVM, the PowerTOP utility exited with an error when trying to read incorrect Machine State Registers (MSRs). With this update, PowerTOP tests MSRs for validity. If the test fails, it falls back to the kernel to obtain information about CPU and does not exit with an error. (BZ#1102088) In addition, this update adds the following enhancement: The PowerTOP utility now has the "--auto-tune" option that applies all known low-power consumption tuning at once, which simplifies tuning the system. However, to avoid unexpected problems, it remains safer to fine-tune the PowerTOP suggestions with the powertop2tuned utility. (BZ#1143014) Users of powertop are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs and add this enhancement. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
